Created attachment 22674
The new module that fixes the bug

When multiple Set-Cookie headers are sent within an HTTP response, "Header edit" action will delete all Set-Cookie headers except the first one. It creates undesirable effect and breaks a web application logic becuase only the first cookie will be created on a client's machine.

I think, more logical solution would be to actually edit the cookie's values and not to delete the existing ones. I've modified the mod_header.c (see mod_headers2 attachment and 'replace_values' function) and tested the new module - it seems to be working, but you might want to verify the code.

To compile the new module use:
apxs -i -a -c -n headers2 mod_headers2.c

New directive names:
Header2 
RequestHeader2

To load the new module use:
LoadModule headers2_module    modules/mod_headers2.so
